I want to correct my last e-mail in this Thread.
Test method of calculator =
should be

public void testNegative() throws Exception {
 try {
  calc.sqrt=
(-1);
  fail("IllegalArgumenException is expecting");
 catch(IllegalArgumen=
Exception e){
  assert true : "it' ok";
 }
}

IllegalArgumenException shoul=
d be thrown in public sqrt() method. This
is not happened because programme=
r forgot to do this check. It is the
bug. Instead AssertionError is thrown =
by the code itself, because
programmer that writed doSqrt() method clearly =
states that his
precondition is that argument is valid. We should be fails =
before.
AssertionError shouldn't happen.
